description: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
description_html: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
name: AbortSignal.any()

description: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
description_html: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
name: accent-color

description: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
description_html: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
name: animation-composition

description: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
description_html: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
name: appearance

description: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
description_html: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
name: ARIA attribute reflection

description: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
description_html: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
name: Array at()

description: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
description_html: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
name: Array by copy

description: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
description_html: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
name: Array findLast() and findLastIndex()

description: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
description_html: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
name: Array.fromAsync()

description: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
description_html: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
name: Array grouping

description: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
description_html: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
name: :autofill

description: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
description_html: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
name: AVIF

description: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
description_html: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
name: background-clip: text

description: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.
description_html: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.
name: BroadcastChannel

description: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN constants are accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().
description_html: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN constants are accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().
name: calc() constants

description: The createConicGradient() methods draw a conic gradient to a 2D canvas.
description_html: The createConicGradient() methods draw a conic gradient to a 2D canvas.
name: Canvas createConicGradient()

description: The reset() method clears a canvas to its initial state.
description_html: The reset() method clears a canvas to its initial state.
name: Canvas reset()

description: The roundRect() methods draw a rounded rectangle to a 2D canvas.
description_html: The roundRect() methods draw a rounded rectangle to a 2D canvas.
name: Canvas roundRect()

description: The alphabeticBaseline, hangingBaseline, and ideographicBaseline canvas text metrics measure the distance from the used textBaseline to the respective typographic baseline.
description_html: The alphabeticBaseline, hangingBaseline, and ideographicBaseline canvas text metrics measure the distance from the used textBaseline to the respective typographic baseline.
name: Canvas text baselines

description: The CSS cap unit corresponds to the height of Latin capital letters.
description_html: The CSS cap unit corresponds to the height of Latin capital letters.
name: cap unit

description: The @layer CSS at-rule avoids specificity conflicts by providing priority levels for different groups of CSS rules, such as low-priority styles like resets, and high-priority styles like UI components.
description_html: The @layer CSS at-rule avoids specificity conflicts by providing priority levels for different groups of CSS rules, such as low-priority styles like resets, and high-priority styles like UI components.
name: Cascade layers

description: The checkVisibility() method checks if an element is potentially visible, with optional parameters for the kinds of visibility to check. For example, it checks whether the element has the style display: none, but can also check for visibility: hidden.
description_html: The checkVisibility() method checks if an element is potentially visible, with optional parameters for the kinds of visibility to check. For example, it checks whether the element has the style display: none, but can also check for visibility: hidden.
name: checkVisibility()

description: The color() function defines a color within a given color space. Wide gamut color spaces like display-p3 allow showing more vibrant and saturated colors than the standard srgb color space.
description_html: The color() function defines a color within a given color space. Wide gamut color spaces like display-p3 allow showing more vibrant and saturated colors than the standard srgb color space.
name: color()

description: The color-mix() function mixes two colors in a given color space and by a given amount. Commonly, lighter or darker variations of a color are created by mixing with white or black.
description_html: The color-mix() function mixes two colors in a given color space and by a given amount. Commonly, lighter or darker variations of a color are created by mixing with white or black.
name: color-mix()

description: The color-scheme CSS property sets which color schemes (light or dark) an element uses and may prevent automatic dark mode adjustments by the browser.
description_html: The color-scheme CSS property sets which color schemes (light or dark) an element uses and may prevent automatic dark mode adjustments by the browser.
name: color-scheme

description: The CompressionStream and DecompressionStream interfaces compress and decompress data using the gzip or deflate formats.
description_html: The CompressionStream and DecompressionStream interfaces compress and decompress data using the gzip or deflate formats.
name: Compression streams

description: The CSSStyleSheet constructor creates a new stylesheet which can be shared between a document and multiple shadow roots using adoptedStyleSheets.
description_html: The CSSStyleSheet constructor creates a new stylesheet which can be shared between a document and multiple shadow roots using adoptedStyleSheets.
name: Constructed stylesheets

description: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will layout the element as if it had a single child of this size.
description_html: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will layout the element as if it had a single child of this size.
name: contain-intrinsic-size

description: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.
description_html: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.
name: Container queries

description: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
description_html: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
name: counter-set

description: The @counter-style CSS at-rule defines custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
description_html: The @counter-style CSS at-rule defines custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
name: @counter-style

description: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
description_html: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.
name: Declarative shadow DOM

description: The DeviceMotion and DeviceOrientation events report the movement and orientation of the browser's device in physical space.
description_html: The DeviceMotion and DeviceOrientation events report the movement and orientation of the browser's device in physical space.
name: Device orientation events

description: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
name: <dialog>

description: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).
description_html: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).
name: :dir()

description: The dirname attribute of <textarea> and <input> HTML elements includes the field's writing direction as form data on submission.
description_html: The dirname attribute of <textarea> and <input> HTML elements includes the field's writing direction as form data on submission.
name: dirname

description: The pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp() CSS functions compute various exponential functions.
description_html: The pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp() CSS functions compute various exponential functions.
name: pow(), sqrt(), hypot(), log(), and exp()

description: The Sec-Fetch-Dest, Sec-Fetch-Mode, Sec-Fetch-Site, and Sec-Fetch-User` HTTP headers provide extra information about the way a request was made, to help servers reject certain kinds of malicious requests.
description_html: The Sec-Fetch-Dest, Sec-Fetch-Mode, Sec-Fetch-Site, and Sec-Fetch-User` HTTP headers provide extra information about the way a request was made, to help servers reject certain kinds of malicious requests.
name: Fetch metadata request headers

description: The :focus-visible CSS pseudo-class selects elements that match the :focus pseudo-class and meets the browser's criteria for visually emphasizing focused elements.
description_html: The :focus-visible CSS pseudo-class selects elements that match the :focus pseudo-class and meets the browser's criteria for visually emphasizing focused elements.
name: :focus-visible

description: The font-palette CSS property selects a color palette from the font, optionally overriding individual colors in the @font-palette-values at-rule.
description_html: The font-palette CSS property selects a color palette from the font, optionally overriding individual colors in the @font-palette-values at-rule.
name: font-palette

description: The font-synthesis CSS shorthand property disables all font synthesis except the given kinds. To disable a specific kind of font synthesis, instead use the longhand properties such as font-synthesis-style and font-synthesis-weight.
description_html: The font-synthesis CSS shorthand property disables all font synthesis except the given kinds. To disable a specific kind of font synthesis, instead use the longhand properties such as font-synthesis-style and font-synthesis-weight.
name: font-synthesis

description: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize small caps typefaces when they're missing from the font.
description_html: The font-synthesis-small-caps CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize small caps typefaces when they're missing from the font.
name: font-synthesis-small-caps

description: The font-synthesis-style CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize italic and oblique typefaces when they're missing from the font.
description_html: The font-synthesis-style CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize italic and oblique typefaces when they're missing from the font.
name: font-synthesis-style

description: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize bold typefaces when they're missing from the font.
description_html: The font-synthesis-weight CSS property sets whether or not the browser should synthesize bold typefaces when they're missing from the font.
name: font-synthesis-weight

description: The font-variant-alternates CSS property, along with the @font-feature-values at-rule, chooses when to use a font's alternate glyphs.
description_html: The font-variant-alternates CSS property, along with the @font-feature-values at-rule, chooses when to use a font's alternate glyphs.
name: font-variant-alternates

description: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.
description_html: Custom elements may act like built-in form elements, via the the attachInternals() method of HTMLElement and the ElementInternals API.
name: Form-associated custom elements

description: Grid animation allows you to animate the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows CSS properties.
description_html: Grid animation allows you to animate the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows CSS properties.
name: Grid animation

description: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
description_html: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
name: :has()

description: The hyphens CSS property controls when long words are broken by line wrapping. Although called hyphens, the property applies to word-splitting behavior across languages, such as customary spelling changes or the use of other characters to mark an intraword line break.
description_html: The hyphens CSS property controls when long words are broken by line wrapping. Although called hyphens, the property applies to word-splitting behavior across languages, such as customary spelling changes or the use of other characters to mark an intraword line break.
name: Hyphenation

description: The CSS ic unit corresponds to the width of CJK ideographic characters.
description_html: The CSS ic unit corresponds to the width of CJK ideographic characters.
name: ic unit

description: The image-set() CSS function provides a set of images at different resolutions or pixel densities, which the browser can pick from, depending on the device capabilities.
description_html: The image-set() CSS function provides a set of images at different resolutions or pixel densities, which the browser can pick from, depending on the device capabilities.
name: image-set()

description: A <script type="importmap"> HTML element provides an import map as a JSON string. An import map controls how the browser should resolve module specifiers when importing JavaScript modules.
description_html: A <script type="importmap"> HTML element provides an import map as a JSON string. An import map controls how the browser should resolve module specifiers when importing JavaScript modules.
name: Import maps

description: Transform elements with separate translate, rotate, and scale CSS properties.
description_html: Transform elements with separate translate, rotate, and scale CSS properties.
name: Individual transform properties

description: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
description_html: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
name: Inert elements

description: The input event fires when a form control changes or an element with the contenteditable attribute changes.
description_html: The input event fires when a form control changes or an element with the contenteditable attribute changes.
name: input event

description: The Worker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in workers.
description_html: The Worker() constructor accepts { type: "module" } to load scripts that use import and export. Also known as ECMAScript modules or ESM in workers.
name: JavaScript modules in workers

description: The CIE Lab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is. LCH is a variant of Lab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), lab(), and lch() functions. Also known as CIELAB and CIELCH.
description_html: The CIE Lab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is. LCH is a variant of Lab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), lab(), and lch() functions. Also known as CIELAB and CIELCH.
name: Lab and LCH

description: The CSS lh unit corresponds to the requested line height, the computed value of the line-height property. Some lines may be higher than this based on their content.
description_html: The CSS lh unit corresponds to the requested line height, the computed value of the line-height property. Some lines may be higher than this based on their content.
name: lh unit

description: The light-dark() CSS function accepts two colors and uses one depending on the current color scheme.
description_html: The light-dark() CSS function accepts two colors and uses one depending on the current color scheme.
name: light-dark()

description: The linear() easing function for animations and transitions interpolates linearly between the control points, and can be used to approximate complex easing functions, such as a bounce effect.
description_html: The linear() easing function for animations and transitions interpolates linearly between the control points, and can be used to approximate complex easing functions, such as a bounce effect.
name: linear() easing

description: The loading="lazy" attribute for and
description_html: The loading="lazy" attribute for <img> and <iframe> elements blocks loading the external resource until the user scrolls to that element's part of the page.
name: Lazy-loading images and iframes

description: The mask CSS property (and several longhand properties) partially or completely hides an element according to the shape and depth of an image.
description_html: The mask CSS property (and several longhand properties) partially or completely hides an element according to the shape and depth of an image.
name: Masks

description: MathML, or the Mathematical Markup Language, describes mathematical notation, such as expressions and formulas. Also known as MathML Core.
description_html: MathML, or the Mathematical Markup Language, describes mathematical notation, such as expressions and formulas. Also known as MathML Core.
name: MathML

description: The range syntax of CSS media queries allows you to use mathematical comparison operators such as <, >, <=, and >= to define a range of values for a media feature. For example, (400px < width < 1000px) returns true if the viewport width is between 400px and 1000px.
description_html: The range syntax of CSS media queries allows you to use mathematical comparison operators such as <, >, <=, and >= to define a range of values for a media feature. For example, (400px < width < 1000px) returns true if the viewport width is between 400px and 1000px.
name: Media query range syntax

description: The messageerror event fires on a target, such as a window or worker, when an incoming message cannot be deserialized. This event can fire for many types of messages, such as cross-document messages or broadcast channel messages.
description_html: The messageerror event fires on a target, such as a window or worker, when an incoming message cannot be deserialized. This event can fire for many types of messages, such as cross-document messages or broadcast channel messages.
name: messageerror

description: The :modal pseudo-class selects elements that put other elements into a non-interactive state, such as a fullscreen element or a <dialog> element used with showModal().
description_html: The :modal pseudo-class selects elements that put other elements into a non-interactive state, such as a fullscreen element or a <dialog> element used with showModal().
name: :modal

description: The rel="modulepreload" attribute for the <link> HTML element indicates that a module script should be fetched, parsed, and compiled preemptively, and stored for later execution.
description_html: The rel="modulepreload" attribute for the <link> HTML element indicates that a module script should be fetched, parsed, and compiled preemptively, and stored for later execution.
name: <link rel="modulepreload">

description: The offset CSS property animates an element along a defined motion path.
description_html: The offset CSS property animates an element along a defined motion path.
name: Motion path

description: CSS nesting allows for shorter selectors, easier reading, and more modularity by nesting rules inside others.
description_html: CSS nesting allows for shorter selectors, easier reading, and more modularity by nesting rules inside others.
name: Nesting

description: The of syntax for the :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements by the relative position of elements, counted from the first or last sibling matching a selector list.
description_html: The of syntax for the :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() CSS functional pseudo-classes match elements by the relative position of elements, counted from the first or last sibling matching a selector list.
name: :nth-child() of <selector>

description: The OffscreenCanvas API provides a canvas that can be drawn to off screen, with no dependencies on the DOM, which can be used to run heavy rendering operations inside a worker context.
description_html: The OffscreenCanvas API provides a canvas that can be drawn to off screen, with no dependencies on the DOM, which can be used to run heavy rendering operations inside a worker context.
name: Offscreen canvas

description: The Oklab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is, aiming to match how humans perceive colors. Oklch is a variant of Oklab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), oklab(), and oklch() functions.
description_html: The Oklab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is, aiming to match how humans perceive colors. Oklch is a variant of Oklab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), oklab(), and oklch() functions.
name: Oklab and Oklch

description: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
description_html: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
name: Origin private file system

description: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
description_html: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
name: overflow

description: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
description_html: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
name: Unsanitized HTML parsing methods

description: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
description_html: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
name: Permissions

description: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
name: Popover

description: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
description_html: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
name: Preloading responsive images

description: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
description_html: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
name: preservesPitch

description: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
description_html: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
name: window.print()

description: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
description_html: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
name: Promise.withResolvers()

description: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
description_html: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
name: Push messages

description: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
description_html: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
name: requestAnimationFrame() in workers

description: The decodedSize, encodedSize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
description_html: The decodedSize, encodedSize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
name: Resource size

description: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
description_html: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
name: round(), mod(), and rem()

description: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
description_html: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
name: Screen orientation

description: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
description_html: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
name: <search>

description: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
description_html: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
name: Server timing

description: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
description_html: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
name: Imperative slot assignment

description: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
description_html: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
name: Storage access

description: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
description_html: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
name: Streams

description: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.
description_html: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.
name: structuredClone()

description: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.
description_html: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.
name: Subgrid

description: The text-wrap: balance CSS declaration balances the length of each line when text is broken into multiple lines. Also known as headline balancing.
description_html: The text-wrap: balance CSS declaration balances the length of each line when text is broken into multiple lines. Also known as headline balancing.
name: text-wrap: balance

description: The text-wrap: nowrap CSS declaration prevents text breaking into multiple lines. Text that doesn't fit overflows instead.
description_html: The text-wrap: nowrap CSS declaration prevents text breaking into multiple lines. Text that doesn't fit overflows instead.
name: text-wrap: nowrap

description: The transfer() and transferToFixedLength() methods of ArrayBuffer move a buffer from one context to another (for example, to a worker).
description_html: The transfer() and transferToFixedLength() methods of ArrayBuffer move a buffer from one context to another (for example, to a worker).
name: Transferable ArrayBuffer

description: The transform CSS property and its 3D transform functions allow rotations and other transforms in three dimensions, including perspective transforms.
description_html: The transform CSS property and its 3D transform functions allow rotations and other transforms in three dimensions, including perspective transforms.
name: 3D transforms

description: The translate HTML attribute marks whether an element's text should be translated.
description_html: The translate HTML attribute marks whether an element's text should be translated.
name: translate attribute

description: The sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() CSS functions compute various trigonometric functions.
description_html: The sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() CSS functions compute various trigonometric functions.
name: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2()

description: The display CSS property accepts multiple keyword values, such as inline flex or block flow, to explicitly set an element's inner and outer layout mode. Also known as 2-value, multi-keyword, or multiple value syntax.
description_html: The display CSS property accepts multiple keyword values, such as inline flex or block flow, to explicitly set an element's inner and outer layout mode. Also known as 2-value, multi-keyword, or multiple value syntax.
name: Two-value display property

description: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a trycatch statement.
description_html: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a trycatch statement.
name: URL.canParse()

description: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
description_html: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
name: User activation

description: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
description_html: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
name: :user-valid and :user-invalid

description: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
description_html: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
name: Small, large, and dynamic viewport units

description: The 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) extension to WebAssembly performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
description_html: The 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) extension to WebAssembly performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
name: WebAssembly SIMD

description: The web animations API allows you to animate and synchronize the animations of DOM elements.
description_html: The web animations API allows you to animate and synchronize the animations of DOM elements.
name: Web animations

description: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
description_html: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
name: Locks

description: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
description_html: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
name: Web authentication easy public key access

description: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension to WebGL allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
description_html: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension to WebGL allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
name: WebGL OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension

description: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
description_html: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
name: WebRTC SCTP information
